replies.body: The fact it pulled out a lightsaber concerned me more than the fact it's trying to invade the house.

> [{quoted}](name=Busty Demoness,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zE6Kg34w,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-02-20T23:09:25.603+0000)
>
> The fact it pulled out a lightsaber concerned me more than the fact it's trying to invade the house.

Except we all know the lightsaber is photoshopped. That's why it's more disturbing that *this is a real life crab that has scaled the wall in a person's home.*
You must be a serial killer. You killed that joke without hesitation.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

Yes, I'm well aware of the lightsaber being photoshopped. That was part of the joke.
Yeah it's pretty common in some areas :b sorta like the foot long centipedes that get in people's shoes in Hawaii.
Well that's hawaii scored off my list of places to see

Yep, that's why people living in Hawaii never just put their shoes on, they check inside them first, here's a picture
https://s3media.247sports.com/Uploads/Boards/852/33852/108858.jpg
they're called House Centipedes, they're not hostile, they just look for places to cool off, and what's cooler than a damp, dark, sweaty shoe?  Also, they're not usually deadly, the only verifiable case would be a 7 year old girl in the Philippines.

> they're called House Centipedes, they're not hostile, they just look for places to cool off, and what's cooler than a damp, dark, sweaty shoe?  Also, they're not usually deadly, the only verifiable case would be a 7 year old girl in the Philippines.

That's not a House Centipede where I'm from. These are House Centipedes: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scutigera_coleoptrata
I've seen pictures of the centipede in your picture in my bug encyclopedia. That has all the looks of a Vietnamese Centipede, which eats small mammals, large insects, and small birds.
House Centipede us the casual name, because they show up in people's houses all the time, it is actually a cousin of the Vietnamese Centipede, but it's native to Hawaii :b
I'm bad enough with the tiny ones we have here in the UK never mind that monster
You've obviously never heard of the coconut crab.

It's terrifying if I could wake up to have massive aqua spiders above my bed. It's bad enough with normal spiders.
I cant tell if thats a wall or a floor, on one hand, who has an indent on their floor? but on the other what ceiling has trim?
